dt: {bc}a blue vat dye obtained from plants (such as indigo plants)
{bc}the principal coloring matter C{inf}16{/inf}H{inf}10{/inf}N{inf}2{/inf}O{inf}2{/inf} of natural indigo usually synthesized as a blue powder with a coppery luster

et: Italian dialect, from Latin {it}indicum{/it}, from Greek {it}indikon{/it}, from neuter of {it}indikos{/it} Indic, from {it}Indos{/it} India
shortdef: a blue vat dye obtained from plants (such as indigo plants)

dt: {bc}a small finch ({it}Passerina cyanea{/it} of the family Cardinalidae) chiefly of eastern North America of which the male is largely deep blue in spring and summer

shortdef: a small finch (Passerina cyanea of the family Cardinalidae) chiefly of eastern North America of which the male is largely deep blue in spring and summer

dt: {bc}any of a genus ({it}Indigofera{/it}) of leguminous herbs

shortdef: a plant that yields indigo; especially : any of a genus (Indigofera) of leguminous herbs

dt: {bc}a very large blue-black or brownish colubrid snake (genus {it}Drymarchon{/it} and especially {it}D. corais{/it}) of the southeastern U.S. and Texas to Argentina

shortdef: a very large blue-black or brownish colubrid snake (genus Drymarchon and especially D. corais) of the southeastern U.S. and Texas to Argentina —called also gopher snake

dt: {bc}one ({it}Baptisia tinctoria{/it}) of eastern North America with bright yellow flowers and small trifoliolate leaves

shortdef: baptisia; especially : one (Baptisia tinctoria) of eastern North America with bright yellow flowers and small trifoliolate leaves
